name: Bacon Pancakes
tip: suck my ass bro i hate coding

ingredients.name: Melted butter (or neutral oil, like sunflower/canola)

directions.title: Preheat the oven and cook bacon
directions.description: Preheat the oven to 200°F. In a large cast-iron or non-stick skillet or on a griddle, cook bacon over medium-high until fat is rendered and bacon is browned on one side, 5 to 6 minutes. Flip and cook until golden and crisp on underside, 1 to 3 minutes.

directions.title: Transfer bacon to paper towels
directions.description: Drain bacon on paper towels; pour off all but 1 teaspoon from skillet (reserve for another use).

directions.title: Combine ingredients to make the batter
directions.description: In a bowl, whisk together flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. In another bowl, whisk together buttermilk, melted butter, and egg. Whisk flour mixture into buttermilk mixture just until moistened, with small to medium lumps remaining.

directions.title: Heat skiller and cook abcon pancakes
directions.description: Heat skillet over medium heat. Cook pancakes in batches: Space slices of bacon evenly around the skillet, leaving space for pancake batter. Pour 1/4-cupfulls batter over each slice. Cook until some bubbles appear on top of pancakes and a few have burst, about 2 minutes. With a spatula, carefully flip pancakes and cook until browned on underside, about 2 minutes. Transfer to a platter, bacon side up, and loosely tent with foil. Keep pancakes warm in oven and repeat with remaining batter, adding more bacon fat if needed. Serve with pure maple syrup, if desired.

name: Senku Cola
tip: suck my ass bro i hate coding

directions.title: Heat up the Dark Honey
directions.description: Put about a cup of dark honey in a small, nonstick skillet on LOW heat. It should be bubbling only a little bit. Stir frequently for 5-10 minutes. Let cool but still warm and liquid.

directions.title: Transfer bacon to paper towels
directions.description: In a separate container, combine lime juice from one lime and cilantro leaves that have been finely chopped. Not much cilantro is needed. You'll have the juice from one lime, then pack as much chopped cilantro as the lime juice will cover, let it sit for 5 minutes, then strain out the cilantro. If you crammed cilantro into a shot glass until full, that would be plenty.

directions.title: Mix
directions.description: Put about 1-2 tablespoons of warm honey into a small microwavable container. Add lime juice and stir. If they do not mix, microwave it for a few seconds and mix again until blended.

directions.title: Chill Mixture
directions.description: Chill this mixture in the fridge. Stir occasionally, it should not separate. The carbonated water should also be chilled. This avoids diluting the flavor if ice is added.

directions.title: Add Soda Water
directions.description: Once they are cold, combine the mixture with 8 oz carbonated water and gently stir. Repeat steps 3-4 with the rest of the honey before it hardens, save for later.

name: Bloom Into You Cheesecake
tip: suck my ass bro i hate coding

directions.title: Butter and Cookies
directions.description: Melt the butter on low heat, put the cookies into a plastic bag and finely crush them, then combine them with the melted butter.

directions.title: Crust refrigeration
directions.description: Line the bottom of a 9” springform cake pan with parchment paper. Spoon in the mixture, press down with a flat object to spread evenly over the bottom of the pan, Place in the refrigerator to cool.

directions.title: Mix the Batter
directions.description: In a large bowl, beat the cream cheese together with the eggs (Add the eggs one at a time until mixed in), cake flour (to prevent the cake flour from making lumps, pass it through a fine mesh strainer), heavy cream, lemon juice , vanilla and salt.

directions.title: Combine Crust and Batter
directions.description: Remove the crust from the refrigerator and pour the mixture on top and spread evenly across.

directions.title: Bake
directions.description: Place in the oven and bake for 30 minutes , reduce the temperature to 300 F and bake for 30 more minutes. Then turn off the heat and leave the cheesecake in the oven for 60 minutes. Let it cool completely.

name: Katsudon - Yuri!!! on Ice
tip: Katsu and the word for victory are pronounced the same in Japanese (カツ and 勝つ, respectively), so athletes will often eat some katsudon before or after they compete.

ingredients.name: dashi stock (you can use chicken or vegetable stock if you can't get a hold of some dashi or dashi powder)

directions.title: Heat up oil in a pan/stove
directions.description: About half full of oil, or ~2cm deep should do, if you have an air fryer, you can also use that

directions.title: Prepare the pork cutlet
directions.description: Use a meat mallet to pound the pork to about 1cm thick. Season the pork chops with salt and pepper, and dust them with the flour.

directions.title: Coat the pork chops with panko and fry them
directions.description: Dip the pork into the first beaten egg, then coat them with panko crumbs. Once the oil is hot, place the breaded pork into the oil.  Fry them until golden brown on each side.  Once they're cooked, remove them from the oil, and set them aside on a plate with some paper towels to absorb the excess oil.

directions.title: Mix ingredients into a pan
directions.description: If you haven't already made your rice, start cooking it now. Add the stock, soy sauce, mirin and sugar to a pan (one big enough to hold both pork chops) and bring it to a simmer.  Add in the onions and cover the pan with a lid.Once the onions are translucent, slice the pork katsu, and carefully (as to keep the slices together, treating them as if it were still a whole cutlet) add it on top of the onions.Beat the remaining two eggs and pour them on top of the pork katsu.  Cover the pan with the lid.

directions.title: Portion it all into a bowl
directions.description: Portion the rice into bowls, once the eggs are done (still kind of jiggly and slimy looking, but not liquid anymore, don't allow the egg to become dry and fluffy), pick up the pan and slide/pour the sauce, onions, katsu, and egg onto the rice in the bowl and top with peas or your choice of garnish.

name: Hamburg Steak
tip: The hamburg steak is given to warriors for their birthday

directions.title: Dice your onions and add them to a pan
directions.description: Heat frying pan on stovetop at medium heat, add either olive oil or butter into pan, & when hot enough add diced onion to sauté When onions are an amber color take pan off heat & turn off stove. Put the onions aside to cool down.

directions.title: Prepare beef with bread crumbs and the onions
directions.description: Put the beef and breadcrumbs in a large mixing bowl, add the salt and pepper, 2 eggs and the sauté'd onions. Mix everything

directions.title: Transfer the beef mixture into a pan
directions.description: Put thin layer of olive oil or butter in the pan before putting in your beef mixture. Put the beef in a large pan on the stovetop, we recommend a 12 inch cast iron pan, & turn heat on to a little above low heat. Compress meat into a big patty shape, including rounding off edges, as much as you can

directions.title: Leave for 6 minutes, then turn
directions.description: Leave hamburg steak alone to cook on low heat for 6 minutes, then loosen sides of the patty with a spatula then moving the patty onto a large plate, turn over pan used earlier & cover hamburger steak on plate then flip both together so patty is back in the pan with raw side down. Put pan back on stovetop & cook the raw side again for 6 minutes

directions.title: Add water and finish cooking the steak
directions.description: After 6 minutes add about 250 milliliters of water into pan, enough to cover top of hamburg steak, Turn heat up to medium then cover the pan with a lid; cook meat for about 15 minutes, Check if meat is done by sticking a toothpick in middle & if it comes out clean it's done.

name: Ramen - Galaxy Expresss 999
tip: If your name is Yuki, don't eat this ramen, you might melt

directions.title: Prepare the broth and cook the noodles
directions.description: Bring water to a boil and add in dash and chicken bouillon. Mix until fully dissolved. While it's dissolving, cook the noodles according to the package instructions

directions.title: Make the shoyu tare and add it to the broth
directions.description: Heat sesame oil in a small skillet over medium-high heat. Add the garlic and ginger and sauté until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Stir and add in the soy sauce and mirin. Stir then remove from the heat. Strain out solids from the tare. Add the shoyu tare to the broth one spoonful at a time until it tastes well seasoned to your liking.

directions.title: Fry the ham and boil the eggs
directions.description: Crisp/brown ham slightly in a frying pan. No need to use oil here, just let it cook for a few minutes on either side. Slide in half and serve 2 halves per bowl. Boil eggs to your desired doneness. For this recipe, the best is a medium cooked egg as the yolk is a bit jammy but not too runny. I suggest topping the ramen with some shichimi togarashi for an extra little hit of flavour.

directions.title: Assemble the ramen
directions.description: Put noodles down in the bowl, pour over the broth and add tare (adjust to your liking). Finish the bowls with all the toppings, and enjoy! Be sure to eat the ham with your fingers, but be careful it's hot hot hot!

name: Mabel Juice
tip: “If caffeine and nightmares had a baby” - Stan Pines

directions.title: Mix all the ingredients together
directions.description: If you want the green Mabel Juice, use green Kool-Aid and green Fun Dip. Stir together with a few ice cubes and tiny plastic dinos. Serve in the pitcher of a blender (do NOT blend!).

name: Punch Romaine
tip: Punch Romaine was served at fancy dinners as a palate cleanser between courses. It was a frozen sweet citrus ice-combining lemon water ice with Italian Meringue then topped with rum and champagne.

directions.title: Mix all the ingredients together
directions.description: Shake. Strain into coupe glass full of crushed ice. Top with champagne.

directions.title: Preheat the oven to 180°C and make the meat mixture
directions.description: Put all of the meat mixture ingredients in a medium bowl & combine thoroughly with your hands. Line the pan with parchment paper. Scoop the meat mixture into a baking pan or bread pan & pat down & smooth over.

directions.title: Mix the topping ingredients and bake the meatloaf
directions.description: In a small bowl stir together the topping ingredients, breaking any brown sugar clumps with the back of the spoon. Pour the resulting sauce onto the top & spread it evenly. Put the glorious loaf of meat in the oven & bake for about an hour or until the middle is a little bubbly & the edges are starting to get dark. Remove from oven, let cool, & serve with yummy sides of your choice.
